result.execSummary:
The defendant Wade Hayes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Fine in amount of $2,400.00. Court costs, all applicable surcharges, assessments and DNA surcharge.  By monthly payments of $100.00 per month commencing on September 1, 2016 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full.
*Nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.

Provide a DNA sample, pay the related surcharge.
Court advised defendant htat as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Associated with Charge #1:  Conviction/adjudication  date corrected.
16A 005380/reapplied.
16A 004961/reversed

Defendant Wade Hayes in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Wade Hayes in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Thomas Potter for Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.

The Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, with medical/treatment and child care release privileges, with credit for 9 days time served.  Defendant taken into custody

-Court ordered defendant pay a fine in the amount of $2,400.00 Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments by monthly payments of $100.00 per month commencing on September 1, 2016 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge by payments in conjunction with the monthly payments assessed in the Court costs, fees and assessments
-Court ordered defendant obtain a DNA sample and cooperate with any treatment deemed appropriate.  Assessment referral form signed and copy given to defendant
-Defendant's driving privileges are revoked for 3 years
-Ignition interlock for 3 years.

 Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Report received and filed.

Defendant Wade Hayes in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk On defense motion court adjourns the plea and sentencing in Branch 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
WCS Report, received and filed

Defendant Wade Hayes in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defense does not challenge the doctor's report from Dr. Pankiewicz that defendant is competent to proceed.    Defendant advised of right to challenge the report.  Court examined defendant as to his waiver to challenge the doctor's report.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives his right to challenge the doctor's report.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Wade Hayes in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Case called and case passed to allow defense counsel time to review the doctor's report with his client.
WCS report, received and filed
Dr. Pankiewicz report dated 10-15-2015, received and filed

Defendant Wade Hayes in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Ron Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Case adjourned for return on doctor's report in Br. 19.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Wade Hayes in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court proceeded with the plea and sentencing.  Case passed to allow defense more time.
WCS report, received and filed
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-29-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Wade Hayes in court with Attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case cannot proceed to plea and sentencing on today's date.
Case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 19.

Defendant Wade Hayes in court with attorney Mark A Pecora.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention program report, received and filed.

Defendant Wade Hayes in court with attorney Mark A Pecora.  Nathaniel Adamson for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Report dated 6/11/15.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by SCRAM and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Wade Hayes in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Wade Hayes in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
